screenshot.caption: PRSL file open in Adobe Premiere Pro 2022

description: You can apply different styles to titles in Premiere Pro to maintain a consistent aesthetic throughout the production. PRSL files allow you to store your various styles so you can access them. You can also export and share PRSL files with other Premiere Pro users, who can then import them to stylize text in their projects.
Premiere Pro comes bundled with PRSL files, but you may also create custom styles and export them as PRSL files. Bundled PRSL files are saved in the following location:
Premiere Pro also stores your default working styles in the workingset.prsl file, which is located in the following location:

Adobe began phasing out PRSL styles and the PRTL title files they styled when it released Adobe Premiere Pro CC 2017. Premiere Pro now directs you to save titles and their respective styles as .MOGRT files (select Graphics → Export As Motion Graphics Template... ).

However, Premiere Pro still supports legacy titles and styles. In Premiere Pro 2022, you can save styles in a PRSL library file by selecting File → New → Legacy Title... , clicking the three-line hamburger icon in the "Legacy Title Styles" pane, and selecting Save Style Library... .
